text: explain in a scientific context :'what is a gallbladder?'  "'a what? "  'an instrument of the bladder.'" he paused. " a bladder is an organ. a human body is the organ of a person's body. it is not a part of their body, but a vital part. the human is part and parcel of that organ, and it can be used to perform functions that are not part or parcel. in the case of an animal, the body can not be removed from the animal's head. but the brain can. and the mind can do things that the rest of us can't.   the man continued. he was speaking in an almost monotone. his voice was low and steady. i couldn't hear what he said, because the words were lost in his words. then he stopped. there was a long pause. after a moment, he continued :   ` the first thing you must do is to take a deep breath.
